Little auks seem capable of switching from pelagic to below-ice feeding, and therefore to cope with a wide range of foraging conditions. Their energy expenditure as determined using the doubly-labelled water (DLW) technique thereby seemed to remain unchanged
29 , yet additional studies combining 3D acceleration recordings of their actual foraging movements, and DLW are needed to fully test the impact of foraging plasticity on energy balance
